meanings.definition: The action of stripping something of its covering or surface layer.
meanings.sent1: The denudement of the tree bark revealed its smooth surface underneath.
meanings.sent2: The denudement of the paint on the old house exposed the weathered wood beneath.
meanings.sent3: The denudement of the cake's frosting left it looking naked and plain.
meanings.sent4: The denudement of the landscape by the storm showed the raw beauty of the earth.
meanings.sent5: The denudement of the bookshelf revealed the hidden compartment within.

meanings.definition: The process of exposing or making bare.
meanings.sent1: After the denudement of the soil, the farmer planted new seeds.
meanings.sent2: The denudement of the mountain slope was caused by erosion over time.
meanings.sent3: The denudement of the room's decorations made it feel spacious and airy.
meanings.sent4: The denudement of the truth in the investigation shocked everyone involved.
meanings.sent5: The denudement of the forest canopy allowed sunlight to reach the forest floor.
